subject: Parenting
title: The Puberty Hormone Surge
description: A quick, practical guide to The Puberty Hormone Surge.

hook.text: A calm twelve-year-old becomes an emotional rollercoaster by thirteen. Hormones flipped a switch.

buildup.text: Puberty floods the body with estrogen, testosterone, and adrenal hormones simultaneously.

discovery.text: These hormones sensitize the brain's emotional circuits, making everything feel more intense.

twist.text: Hormones don't cause emotions â€” they amplify ones that are already there.

climax.text: A minor social slight at school can trigger a neurochemical response as intense as a real threat.

punchline.text: The feelings are real, even when the trigger seems small.

quiz.question: What do puberty hormones do to the brain's emotional circuits?
options: Sensitize them so emotions feel more intense
